sun.name: Sun
sun.description: The Sun is the star at the center of our Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma, with internal convective motion that generates a magnetic field.
sun.interestingFact: The Sun's core temperature reaches 15 million degrees Celsius!

mercury.name: Mercury
mercury.description: The closest planet to the Sun. Mercury rotates three times on its axis every two revolutions around the Sun. It is called spin-orbit resonance.
mercury.interestingFact: Mercury has extreme temperature variations: 427°C during the day and -173°C at night!

venus.name: Venus
venus.description: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system due to its thick atmosphere of carbon dioxide. It rotates backwards compared to most planets.
venus.interestingFact: A day on Venus is longer than its year!

earth.name: Earth
earth.description: The only known planet to harbor life. Earth has liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and a suitable temperature for life to thrive.
earth.interestingFact: Earth is the only planet not named after a Roman or Greek god!

mars.name: Mars
mars.description: Known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface. Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons.
mars.interestingFact: Mars has seasons similar to Earth because it has a similar axial tilt!

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.description: The largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is a gas giant with a Great Red Spot that is a storm larger than Earth.
jupiter.interestingFact: Jupiter acts as a cosmic vacuum cleaner, protecting inner planets from asteroids and comets!

saturn.name: Saturn
saturn.description: Famous for its spectacular ring system made of ice and rock particles. Saturn is less dense than water.
saturn.interestingFact: Saturn would float in water if there was a bathtub big enough!

uranus.name: Uranus
uranus.description: An ice giant that rotates on its side. Uranus has a unique tilted axis of rotation and faint rings.
uranus.interestingFact: Uranus rotates on its side with an axial tilt of 98 degrees!

neptune.name: Neptune
neptune.description: The windiest planet with speeds reaching 2,100 km/h. Neptune is a deep blue ice giant with a dynamic atmosphere.
neptune.interestingFact: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system, reaching up to 2,100 km/h!

pluto.name: Pluto
pluto.description: Once the ninth planet, now classified as a dwarf planet. Pluto has a heart-shaped plain and a complex relationship with its moon Charon.
pluto.interestingFact: Pluto and its moon Charon are tidally locked and always show the same face to each other!

moon.name: Moon
moon.description: Earth's only natural satellite. The Moon influences Earth's tides and has been a source of wonder and inspiration throughout human history.
moon.interestingFact: The Moon is moving away from Earth at a rate of about 3.8 cm per year!
